annotation.TEXT: Alright, now I never fully explored this area. So, first, let's get Mr. Magikoopa out of my face for a moment.
No, my Yoshi with a green podoboo head suddenly is getting away!
Time's running out. I'd better make use of another glitch now so I can keep going!
Okay, stomped Magikoopa, so let's advance as far as I can before he reappears.
Here's Yoshi coin #2, and at this point, make sure you're above the block snake, as the eating block makes a wrong turn here, and if you're under the block snake, you could end up getting stuck!
Gotta break every turn block... (Actually, no. I don't have to, and this was probably a very bad idea!)
Alright, there's midpoint, the remaining two Yoshi coins, and a mushroom! Just be careful not to fall in a hole here. Also, I wonder if those "X"s in the purple lava above mean anything significant?
Alright, now I can get through the door with Yoshi!
Also, I picked up another Yoshi from topp of the secret off camera.
What the?! I think that podoboo just sent me to the absolutely-removed-from-the-freaking-game-forever zone... (Not that it matters, since I was about to run out of time anyway.)

Oh, what? There was another P-switch up here all this time? Well, that kind of makes sense, actually, so you could loot this block of coins after looting the first one on the left side of this area when playing normally.
Oh, that was awesome. MagiMario reappeared in just the right place to get drilled right away!
Nuts. MagiMario's back already, but I'm right there...
The maces themselves won't hurt Yoshi, but don't bump into the sides of the blocks that they're swinging around, or Yoshi will flee!
Of course, it would help if the pencils weren't keeping me from stomping MagiMario! Also, how did I not get hit there?
Die, MagiMario, as usual.
Ha! The sprite limit is messing with MagiMario's magic!
Die, MagiMario! Now, let's see if stomping the P-switch in other parts of this room does anything special...
Gulp!
Oh, but... I can't enter the door with Yoshi while big, so I'll have to give up the cape.
Wow, that was also cool! I bet MagiMario didn't see that coming!
Alright, got all those coins. Now, is there anything special that the P-switch will do down below?
But now I've got Magikoopa to contend with here.

Last time, Mario and Yoshi made their way through the darkness place as they search for the source of the chaos that's been spreading throughout the land. What about this castle? Hmm... It says "ULTRA MULTICHAOS" on the door, so this place must be important...
By the way, if you jump off the top of the screen, you can run along the top, but there's nothing of interest up there, and you'd have to return to this vine to get back down.
Well, it doesn't look like there's anything else special up here, besides this other chunk of coins, which I'm going to clean out.
Well, let's collect them all by making use of the P-switch recycling glitch!
There are some rather interesting things in the scrolling background, by the way. Now, up this vine (wait here, Yoshi), we find a P-switch!
ULTRA MULTICHAOS is cleared, but I'm not entirely done with it yet...
Yoshi is also pencilphobic (or something), and merely touching the sides of them sends him running!
Also, fish. Okay, I'm going to speed up most of this.
Alright, one level left, "Chaos CompleXX". Who's behind the source of all this chaos? Find out next time, on the finale of Chaos CompleXX!
Oh, what's this? There's a whole slew of coins way up there!
Magikoopa and his magic aren't edible, so don't try. Also, watch out for the Thwomps here. You might want to try to stomp MagiMario just to get him out of the way for a moment.
LOL at Mario right there!
Umm... Nuts. I'm too big to fit in the door with Yoshi. But I don't want to abandon him! Maybe if I go take an intentional hit somewhere?
Now, I wonder where I should stomp it...
Grab Yoshi coins along the way, as usual. Hmm... I think there's a checkpoint 1-up around here as well, but I forget exactly where... Well, I'll check for it later.
Oh, good. There's the mushroom right at midpoint. That ought to help me against Magikoopa.
Yes, avoid time up death glitch FTW!
Demo count: 25
Gulp! Yes, I ate Larry! ...But, the level isn't clearing and my time's almost up!
Alright, it's boss time!
Of course, now the music is stopped, and Magikoopa is still pestering me.
Now, just like in Larry's castle of the original game, we have this block snake to deal with. However, be careful, as the floor is slippery here.
Alright, it's boss time! This time will be the less glitchy version.
Good point. Why he dosnt take the whole castle and away with that befor entering level. is beyond me...
Oh, so this is a ultra multi chalengelevel. Yes, this probably will make game better as any others or than.
Magikoopa bites the dust again.
Of course, slide-killing the balls produces a glitched graphic, so I guess this battle wasn't 100% glitch-free...
Come on, MagiMario. Appear where I can stomp you!
So of course, the smartest thing to do is to spin jump again after grabbing my reserve mushroom. Sure, why not?
Whew. That was close. Yoshi almost landed in that weirdly shaped lava down there!
Take Yoshi coin #3, then follow this line of coins down.
Go over the top here, and avoid the purple lava. (Maybe it's boiling grape juice?)
But, yeah, aside from a brown block becoming a coin, it doesn't look like the P-switch does anything special down here.

Whoops! Yeah, Yoshi is spooked by the side of the base block of the mace for some reason. Also, at this point, don't bother following the creating block. Just wait up here near the maces for it to come around.
Okay, mace me!
Okay, getting hit stopped my block-breaking rampage world tour.
Argh! I really hate that "land on two enemy sprites at once and get hurt" glitch! But, why did Mario get hurt there? Was it the Thwomp, or the Dry Bones that injured me?
Ugh... Bowser is getting lazy in building his castles...
Good! Magikoopa's back, but that's alright.
To be continued...
Man, Magikoopa just won't quit it. How can I make him permanently disappear?
That was pretty cool! Still, my OCD wants me to break ALL of the blocks now!
MagiMario boost over the pencils!
Okay, now let's block clone this feather block a couple times.
Ooh, thanks for that boost, Magikoopa!
A few of these jumps are tricky, but with Yoshi, I shouldn't have to worry too much about the maces.
Whew. Managed to catch him while avoiding MagiMario at the same time! And now, I'm at a feather block and the boss door! Sweet!
Uh, oh! It's Magikoopa! Or, should I say... MagiMario? ("Koopa" and "Mario" were tied this time.)
Die (at least for a few seconds), Magikoopa!
Whoa, that was weird. Did I do a little warp there?
Okay, here's how you get this checkpoint 1-up to appear. Circle around this block like I'm doing here. Try to face left as it appears so it'll be easier to grab.

There's a vine, and a bony beetle which isn't edible. Oh, and don't jump on them while their pointy bones are sticking out, or Mario will get hurt, even while riding Yoshi! Also, Yoshi is afraid of touching the bony enemies at all while they're knocked down for some reason.
Now, MagiMario's trying to telefrag me, but it's not working.
Whoops! Well, I really only need one P-switch anyway. Now, let's go see if anything else special occurs in this area that's P-switch related.
Whoa, I jumped the gun a bit there, but at least the creating block was already under me at that point.
Demo count: Chargoggagoggmanchauggagoggchaubunagungamaugg
And just like always, Yoshi isn't... What?! They let Yoshi into this place?! Well, that's unique! (More unique than unique castle!)
Alright, OCD. Satisfied now? Good. Now, let's try to get to the boss room before Magikoopa returns.
Let's try that again...
Alright, well let's just fight the boss again... Oh, wait, I can't in my current state. Alright, never mind.
Grab a mushroom if you want it (assuming you've activated the yellow switch).
Now, I could just jump up there to avoid some obstacles, but I want to play this out the normal way.
Oh, I should've stomped it up here, because that's where the coins appear!
